info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 9:42PM CDT until April 8 at 2:50AM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...
Catoma Creek Near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge affecting Montgomery County.
.Heavy rainfall has occurred since Sunday morning over the Catoma Creek basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Catoma Creek.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Catoma Creek near The U.S. 331 Highway Bridge.
* WHEN...From late tonight to early Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands in the vicinity of the U.S. 331 Highway Bridge occurs. At 24.0 feet, Residential and street flooding becomes a problem... and increases rapidly above 24 feet. Several residences are threatened.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to 22.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to 6.7 feet early Wednesday morning. It will rise to 6.9 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
&&
The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING
